channel.title: Port forwarding wont stay working?
channel.description: so basically my port forwaridng wont stay. is there a way to keep my computer at the same of like 192.168.1.17 instead of constantly changing everytime the wireless router goes off... because everytime it does turn off or we reset it it changes the "ip" which means i have to go back to port forwarding and put in the new ip that i want to port forward for...

item.title: Port forwarding wont stay working?
item.dc:creator: @luna-scape luna-scape
item.description:
@luna-scape wrote:

[quote=“Illadelph, post:6, topic:476269”][quote author=luna-scape link=topic=594419.msg4189064#msg4189064 date=1356596494]
Just use no-ip. Its more safe and you dont have this problem
[/quote]

Its nothing to do with no-ip. his router changes ip everytime it resets causing him having to re-port forward. So the only fix to this is getting a static ip.[/quote]

Yea i just saw that aswell xd

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding wont stay working?
item.dc:creator: @Illadelph Illadelph
item.description:
@Illadelph wrote:

luna-scape:

Just use no-ip. Its more safe and you dont have this problem

Its nothing to do with no-ip. his router changes ip everytime it resets causing him having to re-port forward. So the only fix to this is getting a static ip.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding wont stay working?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Fast guide how:
First open your Network and sharing center.
Second click on the text next to connections (see pic):

GCelF.png857×593

Thrid, click Properties Not Wireless properties.

Fourth, Click IPv4 then properties:

Enter the desired information [Copying mine might take you off the internet]:
Note: Click “Validate upon Exit”

Note: You need to pick your own Alternate DNS, there usually isn’t one set.
How to get the information you need:
Back in step 3, I told you to click properties. If you go to the same panel, and click “Details” something similar should pop up:

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding wont stay working?
item.dc:creator: @Illadelph Illadelph
item.description:
@Illadelph wrote:

Get a static ip.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding wont stay working?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Nicksworld:

so basically my port forwaridng wont stay. is there a way to keep my computer at the same of like 192.168.1.17 instead of constantly changing everytime the wireless router goes off… because everytime it does turn off or we reset it it changes the “ip” which means i have to go back to port forwarding and put in the new ip that i want to port forward for…

Yep there sure is.
Give me 2 mins and I’ll post some pics how.

Read full topic
